{"step_by_step_thinking": "Vesicoureteric reflux is a condition where urine flows backward from the bladder into the kidneys. It is more common in children than in adults. Among children, it is more common in females than in males. Furthermore, it is most common in newborns and infants, as the condition often improves as the child grows older. Therefore, the group in which vesicoureteric reflux is most common is newborn females.", "answer_choice": "A"}
